definition: to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: Therefore, statuary had turn into a three-dimensional political picture poster.
sentences.chinese: 由此，雕塑成为了一种立体的政治“宣传画”。

sentences.english: A poster with the core values of contemporary revolutionary soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这是印发部队的当代革命军人核心价值观宣传画。

sentences.english: Some were still kicking at his likeness and tearing up his posters.
sentences.chinese: 一些人仍然在踢打着他的肖像，撕毁着他的宣传画。

sentences.english: In first glance, Song Wei art works as if is similar to the mainstream media propaganda paintings.
sentences.chinese: 宋微的作品乍一看，好象也是这样的主流媒体宣传画。

sentences.english: XiaoLing asked me to have a look at the picture posters.
sentences.chinese: 你看看宣传画就知道了。

sentences.english: The art department is exhibiting the outstanding posters produced in its classes.
sentences.chinese: 艺术系张贴了他们自己制作的醒目的宣传画。

sentences.english: We once had a poster competition in our fifth grade art class.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾有一次宣传画比赛在我国的第五级美术班。

sentences.english: Propaganda postcard and our lunch, everyone has 9 bowls.
sentences.chinese: 农业丰收宣传画，和我们的午餐，每个人9个碗。

sentences.english: His art rarely read as propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 他的艺术几乎不能被当做宣传画来解读。

definition: blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)
see 黑板報|黑板报[hei1 ban3 bao4]
